message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,800,000. It's a fantastic deal, and I'm confident it will be a valuable asset for your business. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I'm looking to negotiate a better price. I'm willing to pay $1,200,000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering the market value and my budget.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a better price, but $1,200,000 is simply too low for me. I'm willing to come down a bit, but I need to stay above my minimum. I'm offering you the product for $1,550,000. This price is still a great value, and it gives you a significant advantage. Let's make this deal happen!

I understand that you're trying to stay above your minimum, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $1,350,000. This is the highest I'm willing to go, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,350,000 is still a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,450,000. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and allows you to make a strong return on your investment. Let's finalize this deal!

Alice, I understand that you're trying to find a fair price, but $1,450,000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to compromise and offer $1,300,000. This is the best I can do, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I'm running out of time here, and while I want to make this work, I can't go any lower than $1,400,000.  This is a good deal for both of us - it's a solid price for the product, and it allows you to still make a profit.  What do you say?

Alice, I understand your urgency, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $1,350,000. This is the final offer I can make, and I hope you can understand my position.
